html:
FEDERAL ELECTION COMMISSION
News Releases, Media Advisories

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE:			CONTACT:KELLY HUFF
APRIL 4, 1996 				        RON HARRIS
						SHARON SNYDER
						IAN STIRTON

FEC RELEASES 20 COMPLIANCE CASES

WASHINGTON The Federal Election Commission has made public its final action on 20 matters previously under review (MURs). This release contains only summary information. Closed files should be thoroughly read for details, including the FEC's legal analysis of the case. (Please see footnote at the end of this release.) Closed MUR files are available in the Public Records Office.

1.	MUR 4028

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Hugh E. Rodham (FL)
			(b) Rodham for Senate '94, Gary Robert Fine, treasurer (FL)
			(c) Marilyn J. Parker (FL)
			(d) E.C.S., Inc., Marilyn J. Parker, President (FL)
			(e) Clayton Kaeiser (FL)
			(f) Arnold Friedman (FL)
			(g) Greenberg Research, Inc. (DC)
			(h) President Clinton (DC)
	COMPLAINANT:	Ellis Rubin (FL)
	SUBJECT:	Failure to report campaign contributions; corporate 
                         contributions; excessive contributions; falsifying disbursement
                        information on FEC report
	DISPOSITION:	(a h) Took no action*

2.	MUR 4070

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Mary Alice Acevedo (CA)
			(b) Mary Alice Acevedo for Congress, Mary Alice Acevedo, treasurer (CA)
			(c) The Honorable Brian Phillip Bilbray (CA)
			(d) Brian Bilbray for Congress, F. Laurence Scott, Jr., treasurer (CA)
	COMPLAINANT:	Mark Pollick, Esq. (CA)
	SUBJECT:	Failure to register and report joint fundraising committee
	DISPOSITION:	(a d) Took no action*

3.	MUR 4089

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Paul D. Muldowney (MD)
			(b) Citizens for Muldowney, Vicki B. O'Conner, treasurer (MD)
			(c) Dynamark Security Centers, Inc., Wayne E. Alter,Jr., President and CEO (MD
			(d) Supreme Concrete Block, Inc., Louis J. Tiches, President (MD)
 	COMPLAINANTS:	Maryland Republican Party, Joyce Lyons Terhes, Chairman (MD)	
	SUBJECT:	Corporate contributions; disclaimers; failure to properly request contributor 
                         information ("best efforts")
	DISPOSITION:	(a d) Took no action*

4.	MUR 4095

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) James T. Nalepa (IL)
			(b) Nalepa for Congress, Carol Brian Warhanik, treasurer (IL)
			(c) Nalcor Development Corporation (IL)
			(d) Midway News, Inc. (IL)
	COMPLAINANTS:	Daniel J. Kubasiak, Esq., on behalf of Lipinski for Congress
                            Committee, Robert Molaro, Campaign Director (IL)
	SUBJECT:	Corporate contribution
	DISPOSITION:	(a d) Took no action*

5.  MUR 4099

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Haytaian   U.S. Senate '94, Ronald Gravino, treasurer (NJ)
			(b) WABC AM Radio, Inc., Don P. Bouloukos, President (NY)
			(c) Bob Grant (NY)
	COMPLAINANT:	Richard J. Orloski (PA)
	SUBJECT:	Corporate contributions
	DISPOSITION:	(a c) Took no action*

6.	MUR 4102

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) David McIntosh for Congress, Linda Gilcrest, treasurer (IN)
			(b) Republican National Committee   RNC, William J. McManus, 
                            treasurer (DC)
			(c) Indiana Republican State Central Committee, John Johnson, 
                            treasurer (IN)
	COMPLAINANTS:	Indiana Democratic Party, Ann Delaney, Executive Director (IN)	
	SUBJECT:	Excessive contributions
	DISPOSITION:	(a c) Took no action*

7.	MUR 4104

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Friends of Jim Cooper Committee, Robert Alvis
                             Davidson, Jr., treasurer (TN)
			(b) R. Duffy Wall and Associates, R. Duffy Wall, individually and 
                            as President (DC)
			(c) Roy D. Folsom, Vice President, R. Duffy Wall and Associates (DC)
			(e) James D. Massie, Senior Vice President, R. Duffy Wall  
                            and Associates, (DC)
			(f) Carol McDaid (DC)
	COMPLAINANTS:	National Republican Senatorial Committee, Craig Engel, 
                            General Counsel (DC)
	SUBJECT:	Corporate contributions; failure to properly reimburse corporation 
                        for use of corporate facilities; failure to report receipts,
                        disbursements, and debts
	DISPOSITION:	(a f) Took no action*

 8.	MUR 4111

	RESPONDENTS:	Van Hilleary for Congress, Bob Nichols, treasurer (TN)
	COMPLAINANTS:	Tennessee Democratic Party, David Hickey, Executive Director (TN)
	SUBJECT:	Failure to properly report loans; failure to file a copy of FEC 
                        report with the Tennessee state election commission; failure to 
                        provide contributor information ("best efforts")
	DISPOSITION:	Took no action*

9.	MUR 4113

	RESPONDENTS:	Tucker for Congress, Donna Stennis, treasurer (CA)
	COMPLAINANTS:	Guy Wilson for Congress, Alannia Aliza Elizabeth Michael,
                                treasurer (CA)
	SUBJECT:	Failure to properly itemize disbursements; failure to provide
                                contributor information ("best efforts")
	DISPOSITION:	Took no action*

10.	MUR 4117

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Friends of Jim Inhofe, Richard D. Craig, treasurer (OK)
			(b) Oklahoma Republican State Committee, Clinton Key, Chairman (OK)
			(c) Oklahoma Federation of College Republicans,Joseph Kitto, Chairman (OK)
			(d) Rob Anders (OK)
			(e) Oklahoma Freedoms Network, David Dixon, Director (OK)
	COMPLAINANTS:	Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee, Robert F. Bauer, 
                            General Counsel (DC)
	SUBJECT:	Independent expenditure/excessive contribution; disclaimer
	DISPOSITION:	(a e) Took no action*

11.	MUR 4132

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Wynia for Senate Committee, Ellen G. Sampson,treasurer (MN)
			(b) President Clinton (DC)
			(c) United States Government (DC)
	COMPLAINANTS:	National Republican Senatorial Committee, Craig Engel, General
                             Counsel (DC)
	SUBJECT:	Federal government contribution; excessive contribution; failure to 
                        disclose disbursements; failure to disclose debts
	DISPOSITION:	(a c) Took no action*

12.	MUR 4165

	RESPONDENTS:	Manfre for Congress Committee, Michael P. Mercurio,treasurer (NY)
	COMPLAINANTS:	Lazio for Congress '94 Committee, John Maloney,treasurer (NY)
	SUBJECT:	Premature filing of termination report; failure to report receipts and
                        disbursements; failure to report disposition of excess campaign funds; 
                        failure to include treasurer statement that no excess funds would be 
                        converted to personal use; failure to itemize PAC contributions; failure
                        to file disclosure report; failure to report contributor information 
                        ("best efforts"); impermissible contributions 
	DISPOSITION:	Took no action*


13.	MUR 4187

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Murtha for Congress Committee, Robert C. Ondick,treasurer (PA)
			(b) Johnstown Tribune Publishing Company, J. Allen Meath, Chief 
                             Executive Officer (PA)
			(c) Pamela J. Mayer, Publisher, Johnstown Tribune Democrat (PA)
			(d) Howard Saltz, Editor, Johnstown Tribune Democrat (PA)
			(e) Lawrence J. Hudson, Managing Editor, Johnstown Tribune Democrat (PA)
			(f) Bruce J. Wissinger, Editorial Page Editor,Johnstown Tribune Democrat (PA)
			(g) Bill Jones, Chief Editorial Writer, Johnstown Tribune Democrat (PA)
	COMPLAINANT:	Dr. Willeam A. Choby (PA)
	SUBJECT:	Coporate contribution
	DISPOSITION:	(a g) Took no action*

14.	MUR 4188

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Murtha for Congress Committee, Robert C. Ondick,treasurer (PA)
			(b) Ankney Publishing, Inc. (PA)
			(c) Central Pennyslvania Medicine (PA)
			(d)	Western Pennyslvania Medicine (PA)
			(e) Ankney Public Relations (PA)
			(f) Operation Assistance, Inc. (PA) 
	COMPLAINANT:	Willeam A. Choby, DMD (PA)
	SUBJECT:	Corporate contribution
	DISPOSITION:	(a f) Took no action*

15.	MUR 4211

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Governor Tommy G. Thompson (WI)
			(b) Thompson for Wisconsin Committee, Joseph J. Hasler, treasurer (WI)
	COMPLAINANTS:	Hannah Rosenthal, personally and as Executive Director, 
                                Democratic Party of Wisconsin (WI)
	SUBJECT:	Use of state funds/state campaign funds for federal campaign; 
                        failure to register and report 
	DISPOSITION:	(a b) Took no action*

16.	MUR 4216

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Citizens for Dave Obey Committee, John F. Spencer, treasurer (WI)
			(b) Hillary Rodham Clinton (DC)
			(c) United States Government (DC)
	COMPLAINANT:	Delmore Hirsch (WI)
	SUBJECT:	Failure to report disbursements
	DISPOSITION:	(a c) Took no action*
 
 17.	MUR 4224

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Engel for Congress, Debby Linhardt, treasurer (NY)
			(b) Dr. Robert Ross (NY)
	COMPLAINANT:	Barry R. Ziman (VA)
	SUBJECT:	Excessive contribution
	DISPOSITION:	(a b) Took no action*

18.	MUR 4243

	RESPONDENTS:	(a) Initiative 640 Save Our Sealife (WA)
			(b) Champion Marine, Inc. (B.C.   Canada)
	COMPLAINANT:	Bret Barnecut (WA)
	SUBJECT:	Corporate contribution; foreign national contribution
	DISPOSITION:	(a b) Took no action*

19.	MUR 4245

	RESPONDENTS:	Brooklyn Union Gas Company (NY)
	COMPLAINANTS:	Transport Workers Union of America, AFL CIO ("TWU"), David B. 
                                Rosen, General Counsel (DC)
	SUBJECT:	Failure to provide dues checkoff system for union personnel to 
                        contribute to PAC
	DISPOSITION:	Took no action*

20.	MUR 4301

	RESPONDENTS:	MID PAC, Anton A. Weiss, treasurer (NY)
	COMPLAINANT:	FEC Initiated (RAD)
	SUBJECT:	Failure to file disclosure report timely
	DISPOSITION:	Conciliation Agreement: $500 civil penalty*


*There are four administrative stages to the FEC enforcement process:
 1. Receipt of proper complaint          3. "Probable cause" stage
 2. "Reason to believe" stage            4. Conciliation stage
It takes the votes of at least four of the six Commissioners to take any action. The FEC can close a case at any point after reviewing a complaint. If a violation is found and conciliation cannot be reached, then the FEC can institute a civil court action against a respondent.

# # #
title: FEC Releases 20 Compliance Cases
